title: Radiation Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: They asked why I did not have past work experience. Being a homemaker and waiting for kids to grow up may be frowned upon. I do not know how I would describe the process except for to say that it was unorganized. She thought I was someone else for most of the interview
Interview Questions: They asked why I did not have past work experience.

title: Web Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager for a one-on-one interview. They provided an overview of the position and proceeded to ask interview questions. We concluded the call with the opportunity for the interviewee to ask questions. The second interview was with the team of 5 from their various disciplines. Each went around and introduced themselves and then took turns asking 1-2 questions about the interviewees experience.
Interview Questions: Please describe a time when you had to work on a problem that you did not know how to solve. How did you overcome this challenge?

title: Clinical Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with someone from their HR, then I had an interview with the hiring manager. The interview went well everyone was nice, when I went to leave the Manager gave me her card and stated for me to call if I had any questions and I should hear something in about a week. Later that day I sent a follow-up email to HR and the hiring manager. After not hearing from anyone for 3 weeks, I sent another email to HR and the hiring manager. I got an email back from HR stating she was sorry, but they were in the process of hiring another candidate. I understand choosing another candidate, but after three weeks, I had to initiate the response from one of Maryland's largest healthcare facilities is unacceptable.
Interview Questions: Here is a question I thought was unusual. Because of the difficulty this facility had to keep a clinical supervisor, the hiring manager ask, "If hired she wanted a two-year commitment."

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great! Manager was very welcoming. The interview was about 1 hour where she asked questions about my qualifications and some situational questions. This was followed with 2 hours of share time.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time where you had an impact on a patient? Tell me about yourself?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Can be one or two interviews where we start unpaid then get paid depending on our hard work by getting grants for the second year. So first year is usually self funded and second there may be a chance of funding
Interview Questions: Why you want this position and how can it help you in. Your long term goals.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Hanover, MD) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was a very nice interview and the team member are nice and had good manners. process and simple and quick. Questions are all make sense and related the work.
Interview Questions: 1. When the client had a hard time and is complicated how you will solve the issues? 2. explain your work process. 3. your strength

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Bethesda, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Over COVID I had a brief interview over the phone where I was asked basic interview questions including tell me about yourself, a conflict that happened, and how you resolved it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker and how did you resolve it?

title: Cls Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Great interview. Get to know you and the workplace which helps when you start working with the people and familiarize with the system. Be ready and knowledgeable in your field
Interview Questions: N/A

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Smooth interviewing process. Pleasant to talk to recruiter and nurse manager. Throughout the application and interview process, the communication was quick and efficient. They provided great details about the job and answered any questions that I had.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Mercy Medical.

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth and thorough process, enjoyed chatting with them, and they seemed to really care about applicants and helping them continue their education process yea that pretty much it omg
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Research Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Had a screening interview with the Research Program Manager after which I was scheduled for an interview with the PIs. Both interviews occurred within a total of a 2 week period.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Kansas City, MO) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: It has been one roadblock after another. If you are relocating for a job with John’s Hopkins Medicine, make sure you get more information than you could possibly want because they have completely messed up big time while getting me onboarded, now I am stuck moving across the country with no promise of a job because they didn’t send me anything in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and I think you want to work here.

title: Pet Therapy Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Learned important information about the structure of the program & expectations as well as program limitations that were based on the needs of the dog as well as what was best interest of the patients
Interview Questions: How much time I could commit &what units were preferred

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very good interview! I did not feel like I was being interrogated or belittled like I was in the past. The manager was very nice and was happy to answer any questions I had
Interview Questions: They asked me about my work history

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: it was very simple and chill -- the researcher was super nice and collaborative. It really wanted me to be a hopkins student haha, so overall i recommend it to everyone!
Interview Questions: Q. tell me about your research experience

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Standard two interview process. The first round was with the dept HR and then I'm assuming that the three finalists were sent to interview with the dept head of admin.
Interview Questions: Why would anyone want this job?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have an interview with HR. They scren if I have exact experience with job description. screening is very detail and the HR officer is nice and supportive. the interview went smoothly and tranparency.
Interview Questions: What exactly your experience in finance? do you have experience in cost of care or finance management?

title: P Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview process was fast.  The hiring team was very communicative and expectations were set from the very beginning.  It was a rather easy process from beginning to end.
Interview Questions: Asked mostly about experience in school since it was first job out of school

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the primary investigator went smoothly and was friendly. I suggest showing up earlier than the scheduled time to familiarize yourself with the layout of the campus. Be prepared to discuss prior experience and future research interests in detail.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research interest

title: PhD Student - Stipend Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Zoom or Skype meeting, three prof. in your selected domain. more than 1hr long and preparation of introduction about your research is highly preferrable.  The pass rate is approximately 75%.
Interview Questions: Q about your motivations and research

title: Infection Control Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied 1 month ago before being contacted. Once they contacted me through a phone call and via e-mail- Performed phone interview first (two rounds) and a zoom interview with the hiring manager and the whole departmental leaders.
Interview Questions: Could you tell me about yourself & experience?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: it was great and the staff was friendly and awesome. I got asked questions that I was prepared for and overall it was a great experience. I am hoping to hear back from them soon .
Interview Questions: why I am interested in the job

title: P A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: It was a Fairly easy process with a standard initial phone screening prior to interviewing onsite. With regards to the final offer, a quick decision was made. Very communicative through the entire process.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working in a team?

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: straightforward and swift. everyone I met was respectful and nice. Great community of hard working driven people. The neighborhood is not that great. Recommend applying and seeing the area first before committing
Interview Questions: why this job and not another field

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward - whole day no difficult questions. Expected to give overview of experience to date and background. Pleasant environment. There was a tour and meals provided through the day as the interview progressed
Interview Questions:
Why Hopkins
How do you see your career evolving  in 5 years

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and happened pretty quickly. They stressed the importance of college credits, degrees, and education. Overall, the interview process was smooth and easygoing. There’s no need to stress.
Interview Questions: How much college credits you have.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very well organized and streamlined. Everyone was very welcoming and I had a great experience. I decided to join them based on my experience during the interview and it was the perfect decision.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my past experience and how it related to the position

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: You first start by introducing yourself, discuss your experiences, your Understand the preparations paper medical records , scanning, and indexing of the documentation. And discuss your experience on utilizing epic systems.
Interview Questions: Discuss your experience with scanning and indexing

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Saint Petersburg, FL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy Process! Filled out application interviewed on zoom the next day and got offered the position that following Monday.  Loved the recruiter and she explained the job very well.  Been applying to this same company for years and finally got a chance.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last position?

title: Psychiatric Therapist I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The process was two-fold. First meeting was with some members of the team and the final meeting was with the director. They’re interested in checking how your current skill level can match their JD and if you have a thirst for knowledge. Primary focus is on severe mental illnesses
Interview Questions: My Plan after 5 years

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Began with a prerecorded video questions, then a virtual panel interview, lastly a 1:1 with a director.  The entire time they made me believe the position was a permanent role, until the 1:1 with the director. She said they were turning it into a temporary position without benefits and asked if I was still interested. I turned down the position, after it has been falsely marketed and wasted time.
Interview Questions: How have you provided customer satisfaction. What frustrates you, tell me a time you were unable to meet a deadline.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: JHH interview process was truly a positive experience.  I wasn't sure what to expect but it turned out to be a 1/2 day, 6 interviews with the doctors, PAs, nurses, office coordinators...etc.  Very respectful and well done.  Wish I had been offered the job.
Interview Questions: Typical things... tell me about yourself

title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I bypassed the traditional interview process by completing an internship in this lab. I applied for the position via the website and was "interviewed" via my performance at my internship site. I then spoke with the manager at the time and then with HR before accepting formally.
Interview Questions: My interview was based on performance.

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Super long interview period of over 3 months long. The application asked for a resume and 3 references. The first interview was with two researchers and the lab manager. Second with the PI, and third with a Ph.D. student.  After which, the PI asked for three letters of recommendation while being very specific about what kind of recommenders he wanted. No response for two weeks after sending the letters and when asked for a follow-up they said to wait another 10 days for a response.
Interview Questions: Q: Are you okay with a hierarchial lab structure? (PI was Japanese)

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was short and concise. The doctor was polite and to the point. I was able to get my point across and was never at any point undermined or made uncomfortable
Interview Questions: Why do you want join us?

title: New Nurse for the Icu Bridge Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. The people interviewing me were very sweet and not scary. The overall process took between an hour to an hour and a half. I’ll hear back soon.
Interview Questions: They asked me first why I chose to become a nurse

title: Midlevel Provider Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview, pretty basic process, talked for about 20 mins on the phone. Learned about the job and asked simple questions that is asked during a normal interview.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by hiring manager a week after applying for the position. The Initial interview was 30 minutes with the direct supervisor, followed by a 45 minute panel interview consisting of the supervisor  and two senior directors.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Clinical Informatics Analyst- Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, informative, taking the time to get to know my strengths and what I was looking for in the position, along with their requirements and future expectations. Would like to thank all involved in the interviewing process.
Interview Questions: How do I see myself fitting in to their organization

title: Registry Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager and was asked questions regarding experience and overall capabilities. Received information about work environment and requirements. Overall was informative and informed. The people were there and appropriate for the process at hand.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back in less than 2 weeks. One interview and then was offered position straight out of school. Pretty quick and easy process in my opinion. They hire a lot of people fresh out of school.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Customer Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The first item I must stress is to absolutely keep interviewing with other companies. Do not, I repeat, do not stop the interview or job search with other companies.

Johns Hopkins will drag out the interview process for leadership positions for approximately 6-8 weeks and that is after you have spoken to an actual person. This does include the two week wait time for a response from when you submit your resume.

Once you speak to the first person, you will speak to 6-7 other people and then have to wait about a week between each interview.

The questions are standard but specific and mostly tailored to customer service, empathy, and conflict management.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me of a time that you had to deal with an upset customer/client but the fault wasn't your own? How did you handle it?

title: Patient Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview. Asked the basic questions, strengths, weaknesses, explain a time when. Does over the job and what their ideal candidate is. Also goes over the daily duties and expectations.
Interview Questions: Strengths/ Weaknesses, Name a time where something didn't go as planned and how you fixed it, Situational questions

title: Senior Research Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Process can differ depending on department. Be prepared to interview with at least two different people. Also be prepared with a handful of insightful questions before the interview and also with questions regarding things the interviewer(s) mentioned.
Interview Questions: Best qualities of yourself? How do you handle difficult situations? How does your current experience relate to positions?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very chill and laid back. I assumed it went really well. The supervisor showed me around and even spoke to me after the interview as if the job was already mine. sayin things like "when you start, you'll probably be a size small for your scrubs, you can send your schedule to me etc" Like I was guaranteed this position already
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I met with the nurse manager on the unit. I had a brief interview about my experience, she asked me clinical knowledge questions related to the patient population. she then she offered me share time with one of the  staff nurses.
Interview Questions: clinical knowledge quiz

title: IT Tech Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and lengthy. It also takes a long time for them to get back to you and notify you about the next steps of your interview. Sometimes they would not notify people if they are not selected.
Interview Questions: What can you bring add this company?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Quite easy-going. Met with the post-doc who was looking for a research assistant. Asked me few questions, then described several ongoing projects that seem interesting to me. I walked in, thinking it would be about 30 minutes long, but the conversation was so interesting that we ended up talking for nearly 2 hours!
Interview Questions: What about the project(s) interest you the most?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was 2 step. The first step was an on-site interview with 4 individuals. Secondly, it was a presentation with a panel of interviewer who simulated a situation that this role would need to handle.
Interview Questions: How do you describe cultural competency?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had to com pl late a personality quiz.  They were quickly responsive.  Setup interview the following week.  Hour long interview with panel of 3.  I think they were going through motions and had already decided on candidate.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral questions were asked pertaining to employee relations by a group panel consisting of about 4 people. Also had to meet with the Director after meeting with the panel. Received follow-up maybe two weeks after the interview
Interview Questions:
Describe a mistake you made and what you learned from that mistake
Describe one of your most challenging employee relations issues you had to deal with.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, then in person interview. I was interviewed with the supervisor of the department and three team leads. Overall, the interview was fairly easy. After interviewing I shadowed someone in the department.
Interview Questions: What was your least favorite thing about your last position.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Share Day (shadow the unit you applying for)
Basic interview question 
Must bring documentation such as certifications, references and change of clothes (scrubs)
The interview is then asking you questions and you asking them any questions
Brief overview of the job 
Salary discussion
Interview Questions: How would you past employer describe you?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Columbia, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic questions about why I wanted the job, my experience and where I was in school and where I wanted to see my career. It was myself, the "unit manager" I would be working under (my supervisor), director of nursing and the nurse recruiter.
Interview Questions: "what is the hardest part of the health care field to you?"

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was got a call back in a couple of days. It was a panel style interview and lasted about an hour. Took a couple of weeks to hear back from them that they had selected another candidate.
Interview Questions: Asked about why I thought I was a good fit for the job and what programs I had experience with.

title: Child and Family Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: First was contacted by a recruiter, who gave my name (and the names of about 5 others equally qualified therapists) to the Program Director, who then reached out to me and scheduled an interview. There was an initial interview with the recruiter in HR, then an interview (same day) with the Program Director, Head Child Psychiatrist, and the two other Master's level psychotherapists. After that, I was introduced to the Bachelor's level staff. All were able to ask me questions re: my experience as well as my thoughts on various situations.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a child who was reporting abuse by an adult unrelated to them?

title: IT LAN Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel style interview process, at least 3 interviewers, All from different departments. Each interviewer had a different viewpoint. They took turns conversing and transcribing notes.  Interview lasted about an hour and not all questions were technical. Some were process related.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you handled a hot customer and what you did to resolve the issue.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Met with nurse recruitment, interviewed with the manager, had share time (changed into scrubs and shadowed a nurse), then met with a recruiter. The process took up a few hours to be prepared to spend some time there! Everyone was friendly and helpful in guiding me through the process.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had a difficult patient?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview - super easy going and there was no pressure at all. The woman interviewing me was very kind and understood that it was an entry-level position, and didn't make me feel bad about my lack of experience.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in the next year or two?

title: Community Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call about 2 weeks after applying and was invited to interview in-person. Interview itself was pretty standard, was with a panel of current team members. After that I was invited for second interview, but I was out of town for 2 weeks and they refused for wait for me to come back to reschedule. Thus, they pulled me from consideration.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Administrative Coordinator-Healthcare Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process with unecessary testing strange questions to see how fast I could type and why I am passionate to be at a front desk. It was very informal laid back pretty rushed
Interview Questions: How fast can you type. Can you greet people in friendly manner. Do you like people. What is your biggest weakness

title: Social Work Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Overall, I found the interview to be very nice! I applied for the position a couple months ago, and finally heard back in November. I interviewed on a Friday over the phone as a panel, and never heard back, which is the con to the process. I even sent a following email thanking them, since I was going to have to relocate. Would have been nice to at least get an email, stating they went with someone else.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you experience conflict, and how did you resolve it?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview then a two day interview/shadow. It was amazing. Unique experience. Phone interview was lengthy. In person was more of shadowing. Needed drug screen and background check and shots.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place with a panel of three. The questions were based on personal attributes associated with my resume. How I could be of benefit to the department etc.
Interview Questions: What will you bring to the healthcare environment from the different path of the past?

title: Patient Access Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen first be prepared to go over resume, research Hospital, then you will possibly meet with hiring manager, waiting to see if I get an offer by Monday, work on answering management style questions
Interview Questions: Asked questions like: your management style, what would you do within the first 30 days of being in this position, going over work history, why work for Hopkins

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Glen Burnie, MD) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two step interview process.  First met with the supervisor and then met with the team I currently work with.  Questions were general; your history and interests.  The team explained their roles and what a day to day work life would look like.
Interview Questions: DO you feel that you handle competing priorities successfully?

title: HR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was a casual one on one discussion about my past performance and work experience and how it relates to current position.   Introduced to other team members during interview and received tour of the offices.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time....

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview with 2 rounds. Round 1 was with a panel while round two was usually with a senior leader.  The process was reasonably well structured with clearly defined flow.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: A couple interview days that took around 3 hours long in order to meet the staff and follow up with questions. Also got to receive first-hand experience with what a typical work day would look like in terms of obligations and task difficulties.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in the next 5 years

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was then invited for an in-person interview. The interview was with a panel and consisted of many behavioral questions and a tour given by current employees. They also asked me to fill out a worksheet with three questions at the beginning of the interview.
Interview Questions: What are three weaknesses and what steps are you taking to improve them?

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was not difficult but was very long. It dragged on for months and I was hired last minute before the study began. Just go in confident and put your best foot forward. Show how you joining will benefit them.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to get out of this position?

title: Clinical Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was easy with nurse manager. A lot of character questions and why should I hire you questions. Spoke with 3 nurses in the unit and spent time with a CCSR at the front for about 30mins
Interview Questions:
Why should I hire u 
What is something about u  , u think u should work on 
What will ur past employers say about u 
Tell me about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty smooth.  There were two interviews. The first was set up over email and at the medical campus. They asked me basic behavioral questions. The second was set up over email, too. It was over Skype and just about my committment.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Bethesda, MD) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Know about the specialty what they offer, pay, and read about their mission and values because all this is critique during the interview. Not sure about an exam or anything of such but be on alert because other places ask for these things and you should know them. So you meet with human resources and then you meet with the nursing recruiter.
Interview Questions: Best specialty

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Sending in a cover letter + resume, and being called in for 2 rounds of interviews. Interviews are conducted over skype call, and if selected, you are contacted by phone and email quickly.
Interview Questions: How much are you willing to work?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: i had to hand in a cv and they asked me a couple of questions about my experience . I told them about my experience in the medical field. They also asked me about my background
Interview Questions: What kind of previous experience do you have?

title: Research Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted through email for a phone interview. The PI and two other researchers involved in the study joined me for a conference call and for about 30 minutes, they described the study to me and explained what my job would be. I was asked if I was still interested and what I would like to get out of the job. We then scheduled an in person interview with the PI and one of the researchers in the conference call. During the interview, they went into more detail about what the job entailed, hours, how long the current phase of the study would be, their day to day expectations, etc. They asked about some of my past experiences and how those experiences could help me with this job.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: This was an internship interview, which was due to a part-time role. It was lengthy, but the interviewers were pretty nice. It took around 2 hours. They asked me about my previous app development work, and then a couple of basic questions regarding programming.
Interview Questions: Show your previous work, probably a presentation relating to software development. A couple of basic questions in Python and Java.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward group interview.  All went well into the Director walked in and proceeded to ask questions that he got straight out of a book, or some seminar that he must have recently attended.
Interview Questions: Situational questions (i.e. how do you handle a difficult employee)

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was a brief and efficient interviewing process.  I met with a group of researchers in the laboratory -- post docs, grad student then the PI and told each about my own research then learned more about their research and how I would be involved.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Process took 10 days. First i got email from the hiring manager to set up a phone interview. After phone interview I was asked to come to the campus for face to face interview. Interview was simple. I was asked about my previous experience. They told more about them and about the job. Finally, i was given the tour of lab.Overall, the interview was easy.
Interview Questions:
Which type of microscope you worked on?
what type of staining you did earlier?

title: Clinical Nurse Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email by manager, had conversation to see if still interested in position and to share info about position. After confirming I was still interested, referred to HR for scheduling of interview. Interview was with three individuals, two co-workers, one Director. Was quizzed during interview on common nursing competencies. Was asked to demonstrate how I would teach blood pressure.
Interview Questions: Why have you had such varied experience?

title: Attorney Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Extensive recruiter interview and  phone interview.  Interviewers on phone were not themselves very clear about the role of the job.  I don’t think it had been worked through yet. Very difficult to figure out what the role would have been.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this job

title: Patient Access Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Came in three times. Was asked basic situational interview questions. Answered all questions.  Pretty similar to other online situational questions.  No tricky questions. What would you do if you had a situation where your boss wanted a project completed in little time..
Interview Questions: Standard Situational questions

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It went well, the process was very simple. It was a 1:1 interview between me and the department administrator. The process took approximately 1 hour in length and was very cordial.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What makes me qualified for the position? What are my strengths and weaknesses? And where would I like to see myself in the next 5 years?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received a call from HR within a few days.  I was given an interview time a few days later.  I showed up at the appointed time and stood in the lobby with a few construction workers for about 10 minutes- no employee to be found.  Finally someone rescued me and brought me to where my interview was. 

That really should have been my first clue to turn and run, but I didn't.  Next the HR rep walked me through the dept and spoke to each of the 4 panel members that were going to be interviewing me.  One appeared as though he had no clue while the others didn't seem to want to be bothered- clue #2.  They stuck me in a conference room for 20 min, by myself which turned out to be clue #3.  The interview went fine until I had exhausted all of their questions.  

I could tell one of the panelists just had an issue with me, which is fine, however, he seemed hell bent on making me look like an idiot with a "gotcha question" so he could push his case that I was not a good fit for the job.  He asked some off the wall question, that had no relevance to the job.  After another panelist balked at him asking the question, he admitted that they don't ask that particular question of applicants any longer because "no one could answer it."   

The interview lasted about an hour and I was told I would hear from them the following week.  The interview was on a Friday.  I hand delivered thank you notes on Monday, and have yet to hear a word from them.  That was months ago.  I knew from the time I was first standing in the front lobby, alone, that this was not a place that I wanted to work.  The interview confirmed that.  I followed through on my commitment to the interview and followed up with thank you notes.  They in no way showed me the same respect.
Interview Questions: You have eight balls all of the same size. 7 of them weigh the same, and one of them weighs slightly more. How can you find the ball that is heavier by using a balance and only two weighings?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Went pretty smoothly but only heard back from HR about 2 weeks after the application. HR interview was within a day of hearing from them. I was called into the office to speak with a recruitment specialist, who was very friendly, and she asked me typical HR questions about my work history, interest in the job, etc.
Interview Questions: Typical questions: strengths and weaknesses, how do I deal with colleagues, how do I stay on task, what do previous employers think about me, etc.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Too long, HR takes way to long to complete their processes. Once i heard from hiring manager it was fast!! Not much else to say except very frustrated with how long it took to actually get around to hearing from the hiring manager
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Hopkins

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from Human Resources. Group interview with supervisor and lead. Very unintellignet Lead, Asking questions that she herself did not know answers to or knew wrong answers.
Interview Questions: Hands on test for blood draw

title: IT QA Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Glen Burnie, MD) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was different... They made it difficult to answer their questions. Before I could answer one question, the interviewer continued to cut me off to ask another question. The panel interview was different than anything I ever experienced.
Interview Questions:
If I asked you how would calculate all the gas stations in the US, how would you do it? 
Hint: Google is not an option

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was standard. I first spoke with a recruiter to get a brief overview of the position, then met with the hiring manager along with the team.  Overall the process was long, but really what held up the process was HR and setting up the different test.
Interview Questions: I do not think there were any questions that were "difficult." They asked about my experience and made me give examples on how I would handle issues.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process was fairly smooth and efficient. First was a phone interview with two people from the department. Two weeks after the phone interview, I receieved a phone call to come in for an in person interview and a skills test. The interview was held by a panel of 4 women from the department who were all really nice. The next day I was asked to come in and meet with the head of the department. I took that as a good sign, however i was very nervous. Two weeks later, I accepted the offer. Everything went well.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Senior Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview is followed by a in person interviews with 4 people, on 3 different campuses. They asked questions regarding different aspects. Then they spoke with my 3 references.
Interview Questions: What is your career goal?

title: Clinical Neuropsychology Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: 30 to 45 minute Skype interview with division faculty to discuss past and current professional experiences including research, as well as future career and personal goals. It was a lovely interview.
Interview Questions: My experience and career goals.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: The overall process was very informal. I had a very brief phone interview and was asked to come in for a one on one interview the next week. The one on one was about 1.5 - 2 hours long and basically went over what the job would entail and assessing my expertise. After that I was introduced to the rest of the group and had a very informal conversation with every one in the group, and that was to get a feel for weather I would fit into the work environment.
Interview Questions: What are your priorities in life?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: General questions on resume, transcript, past research experience. One on one meeting with the principal investigator. Asked questions regarding PI's current research/papers read regarding the topic and what ideas you would be able to contribute to the lab
Interview Questions: Descript your past research experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online. Interviewed on-site. Compensated for trips and moving expenses. After you speak to the nurse manager, you spend some time with other clinical staff on the unit. You can ask questions about the work and staff in person from a clinical staff.
Interview Questions: Past work experiences. I knew the nurse manager because I worked on the unit as a ClinTech when I was in the nursing school.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview was brief, and merely a formality. A research study I was working for had concluded and I was referred to this position. Many positions here are filled internally or through family/friend referrals. Interviews are held at the sole discretion of the Principal Investigators, so interview experiences vary tremendously.
Interview Questions: Your study has a participant retention rate of 70%, and is dropping. What measures and incentives will you pursue to bring that rate back up?

title: International Case Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: skype interview, really slow process, takes at least 2 months. you interview with many, even ones that don't know what your job description is about. no test needed by medical terminilogy test is a must. you will interview with nurses.
Interview Questions: why patient care

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: very efficient. the questions were clear and precise. I had no difficulty understanding what was asked of me. a panel of 6 people asked me questions then I did a clinical interview and simulated on the job situations
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a difficult patient? how did you handle the situation

title: Team Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was originally already working for Hopkins main hospital I was interviewed for a position at Johns Hopkins Home care in the medical records department. The manager felt as though I would be a better fit in a different department where i can utilize more of my skills. I was interviewed by the HR manager, then a panel interview with the Pediatrics at Home department.
Interview Questions: What would you do if the phone is ringing constantly, you have a  referral that needs to be put in immediately and staffing issue occurring, how would you handle that situation?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the manager at a Cafe in the campus. We talked a lot. She asked me about my background and my future plans. After that, she introduced me the job details and what she expects from my role. Then, even better, she gave me a tour inside the campus. Few days later, she emailed me her decision.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself.

title: Associate Director School of Nursing Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. Call/email to come for an interview. There were several Panels of 2-4 people, They were a bit intimidating. The interview took most of the day. They are not very specific about where to meet so you might want to get there the day before to figure out where the meeting really is. They will tell you one place and will expect you to find the other. Not sure if this was part of the 'test'. The overall atmosphere was pretty unfriendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult situation you have handled at work.

title: Research Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very personable and made it easy to feel like the department was a great place to grow. The position was entry-level but came with an array of opportunities for growth.
Interview Questions: What does your agenda look like?

title: Nurse Clinician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the unit manager. A very general conversation, then shadowed for 2 hours with a staff nurse. I had an interview with 2 different units, so I was there for about 6 hours. Both interviews were veryblaid back and I was offered a position on both units. I did like shadowing on the units. It gave me a since of where I would like to be.
Interview Questions: Why did I chose nursing?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview with direct staff in unit. Converses with director of hospital then HR for further review. Interview process was average and a great opportunity. You were able to learn about the job position fully.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have

title: Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume online. I had a phone interview and then was asked to come in for a personal interview. I felt very comfortable during the interview. The interview questions were very direct with the focus of past performance.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you had a hard time with a supervisor.

title: Various Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring manager gets the sheet from HR and will only ask the question from it. Be prepared to tell about the time when you had to.... etc
Takes a while to hear back once you're done with all of your interviews.
Interview Questions: tell about the time when you had to learn new software

title: Research Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Within two weeks, had two interviews set up. One began with a phone interview, followed by a team interview, and then finally a meeting with the PI. The other consisted of an interview with the PI, very conversational; the PI spoke more than I did. 

Both interviews were standard. Be prepared with references, they always want them.
Interview Questions: Describe your preferred managerial style. Describe how you work best. Tell me about you. Why are you leaving your job.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Paper Application, then in person interview. Interview consists of several individual interviews with different faculty. Interview lasts 2-3 days. You also meet with other students in the program to see whether its a good fit.
Interview Questions: Past research experience

title: Clinical Research Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: On-line application took some effort as Resume import did not format well. Phone interviews by HR and unit of hire--whole process took about 6 weeks even though I had worked with the group before and the knew my work was sound. Apparently, the HR process is step-by-step regardless of who makes the recommendation to hire.  It was fine--it was just going through the bureaucratic paces.
Interview Questions: How well do you work in a diverse environment?

title: Web Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Johns Hopkins Medecine is notorious for a slow, cumbersome, multitiered, and disjointed interview process in which various departments such as OccHealth, HR, and management do not always receive the necessary documentation to allow for a smooth and efficient hiring process. They also tend to place applicants through marathon interview session with multiple employees without comprehensively explaining each individual's role and how he/she may or MAY NOT interact with the new hire on any given day. I know that I interviewed with a number of people for whom I never directly worked with or for.

All that being said, while unwieldy, slow, and sometimes confusing, everyone that I interviewed with was kind, candid, insightful, and clearly interested (eventually invested) in my success.
Interview Questions: Who do you think are the leading thinkers/experts on Web content development? The

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with my PI on the phone first and had a face-to-face interview with department head and my PI. Interview did not take so long. just 20 minutes. the atmosphere was very friendly.
Interview Questions: What is your long-term goal

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Meeting up at informational interview, and very casually started conversation, with an offer. Mostly due to the right timing as the internal colleague informed me of the availability of the spot.
Interview Questions: What's your background research? We are looking for XYZ, have you done XYZ?

title: Medical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Washington, DC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with two individuals, supervisor and manager. Generic style questions and half was focused on conflict resolution and customer service related issues as opposed to skills and knowledge of the job description.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Compensation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called in for two interviews on same day- with team and sr director. it was a fast process, they interviewed other candidates in the same week and made a pretty quick decision. Called me to make an offer base don what they could offer monetarily...the process of onboarding once you receive an offer however is very long and can take at least a month.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Gave a talk to the lab and other invitees. Met coworkers separately and discussed about their work. Significant was 1:1 discussion. Spoke to coworkers during lunch and dinner as well.
Interview Questions: What is you motivation to apply for thai job?

title: PSO Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was really no interview. It was a one on one session to tell interviewer about yourself. The interviewer explains what the position is all about and what your expectation for that position is.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Legal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I received an initial contact just a few days after my application submission. I was to come in for assessment testings which included mostly grammar and a few basic mathematical questions. You had to answer as many as you could within the amount of time designated on the computer. I then had my initial interview with an HR representative who asked be the basic questions, explained the position to me, told me a little history about the organization and gave me favorable feedback that I would be recommended for a second interview. 

I attended the second interview with three attorneys from the department . They each had a list of questions they asked me. The questions were typical. Scenario questions, strengths and weaknesses, and why I am looking for a new position. It did seem a bit overwhelming because each attorney did have a long list of questions I had to answer and was somewhat overlapping. 

After the interview I was told It I should hear back in a few weeks, however, I did not hear back from them and in fact you have to go online to determine what your status is.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question for me was finding words to express your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: You need to apply online, 3 recommendation letters. ps, cv and other materials. After you pass the first round, you need a campus visit. you need 3 round interviews with the professors. It is more like nice conversations and do not be nervous. They prepare nice hotels and food, so enjoy the compus visit. Then you have to wait for about 2-3 weeks for the final result. Good luck!
Interview Questions: Why do you choose JHU?

title: Financial Residency Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: There is only one round of interview facing two interviewer at the same time, one is assistant administrative and one is a senior financial analyst,  the most of the question are straightforward and some are technical, but the interviewer are definitely friendly and considerate. They are looking for candidates that are hardworking, smart, not aggressive, team player and eager to learn.
Interview Questions: Question about statistic (p-value, t-test)

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was straight forward. I had five people interview me. It was great. Straight questions about research. BOOM. Prepared well for it.
Interview Questions: Why Johns Hopkins. You know Harvard Med is no. 1 !

title: Administrative Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Communication with the hiring manager was excellent. First, a phone interview with several people, standard questions, about 30 minutes total. Then, an in person interview with the managers of several departments, but I went one at a time, so had 3 half hour interviews back to back to back, which was tiring.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you made a serious mistake.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the JHU careers website, waited a few weeks, was contacted by someone in HR to set up a phone interview. After my initial phone interview with HR, I was contacted by the hiring manager for the position to set up another phone interview. After that I was brought in two separate times to meet with each supervisor.
Interview Questions: What are some suggestions you have to enhance our web presence?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview consists of  phone interviews, and an in-person interview.  The interview schedule was packed in 1/2 hour slots for 1:1 and group interviews.  There was even an interview over lunch.  There is a full drug screen and physical with Measles, Mumps, Rubella & Varicella Vaccine.  TB check also.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you over other candidates?  Are you married?

title: Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly relaxed interview. Once accepted, however, obtaining clearance from occupational health was a pain in the butt (blood tests, then waiting, then getting vaccination boosters, then waiting again, tb test, waiting, getting test read). It took about a month to get me cleared to work.
Interview Questions: Do you have any issues working with human bodily fluids and feces?

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Learnt about the position from one of my contacts- senior student at JHU.
Interview was straight-forward, was asked details about the specific experiments and concepts.
Interview Questions: I was asked specific concept-based question on site-directed mutagenesis: why is Dpn I treatment used?

title: Research Tech-Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a very relaxed and chill interview. PI seemed very passionate with his research and it was noticeable that he wanted to hire an individual that would be willing to work hard and show interest in his research too.
Interview Questions: None really, but if I have to say one I guess it would be when the interviewer asked about my future plans and if I had any questions after the interview

title: Human Resources Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick interviewing and decision making.  Came in one day and was hired the next.
Interview Questions: If you were a vegetable, what would you be?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy & unorganized.  Seemed as though they had no information on me or my interview date and time.   Even though I knew someone working in that department and was working at Hopkins for many years prior.
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Recommended by my PhD advisor to work on a medical imaging project.
Interview Questions: no questions asked.

title: Provider Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Glen Burnie, MD) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and informal. Spoke about current and future projects. Did a lot talking under their breath and discussion of irrelevant information that had nothing to do with position.
Interview Questions: Nothing specific. A lot of talking about themselves.

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: series of phone calls due to me being out of state. I spoke to 3 different people about my clinical ability to perform respiratory task. All interviewers also asked generic interview questions
Interview Questions: what is one thing you failed at, and what did you do to correct it.

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then received an email from the executive assistant to the Vice President. Was asked in for a Panel Interview with all of the other Directors in the Department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you thought outside of the box in regards to cost-savings for planning a big event

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Aside from the huge online application and quiz the interview process was pretty easy. One phone screen which basically covered general skills and interest questions. Next was the in person interview with two managers asking more technical questions. The final interview was with senior management and an additional team member with slightly more technical questions. Everyone was very friendly and not intimidating. The questions were pretty standard and it overall felt more like a conversation.
Interview Questions: How do you present your responsive design concepts to clients?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied by emailing my CV and coverletter to the PI of  my interested directly. Then I received reply quickly via email asking what my plan for next few years. I wrote a 1-page statement of interests and got onsite after a week. The onsite lasted for a whole day. I firstly was asked to give a 45min presentation. Then I talked to all lab members 30min each. At lunch I talked to lab technicians. Finally the interview was ended in a bar. I was almost sure that i got the offer. The offer was sent after a week.
Interview Questions: Was asked what I want to do in the next few year

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process for interviewing really depends on which department, center, or institute you talk with.  Some are very formal, others are totally informal and can be very impromptu.  Expect a very long time for the entire process to be completed.  Also, the HR department filters out many of the CVs that are submitted online, so if you never hear back it could be that the CV was not forwarded to the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: There were no behavioral questions, but again, every group is different.

title: Software Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with project leads that had very little technical knowledge.  They asked generic questions that were very easy to answer.  resuts may vary because each team does their own interviews.  The team I am on now gives a much more difficult interview and actually asks to see writing skills etc.  I recomend applying for one of the smaller teams to start.  Once you are onboard you can move anywhere you like.
Interview Questions: Q. Are you a team player?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: submitted application online, was emailed briefly about coming out for an interview, discussed my previous experiences and what I hoped to achieve in the future and what i would like to get out of the job, what my availability was, the pay was shown to me upfront and was decent, and the interviewer was the PI himself.
Interview Questions: what i hoped to be in the future, which i didn't know yet for myself

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. You had to know your resume well and make sure that you know what you are talking about. Definitely sell yourself. It's a competitive environment and everyone there is there for a reason. There wasn't too much small talk. Definitely dress professionally even if the doctor is in scrubs. I wore a full suit to my interview.
Interview Questions: What was your major?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal. The PI had a general conversation about my previous work, and what I expected of my new job. The focus of the interview however was more on how they couldn't offer as much as I deserved. Very few technical questions were asked, however I did get to see the lab so I got a feel of whether I liked the kind of work they did.
Interview Questions: Some questions were asked about my personal life, that aimed at relocation of my family etc.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (New York, NY) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
interview process is very simple, there are 2 rounds one is technical and another is pi
in technical round they asked abt puzzels and after that in pi round they ask abt simple hr questions
Interview Questions: why should u join this firm???

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview, then in-person interview.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Six hours of presentations and technical interview.
Interview Questions: Why you want to leave the previous employer.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Medicine (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview process for getting into the graduate school is moderate, not stressing you out.
Interview Questions: What's your opinion on lipid raft?
